newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech CSOB lowers prime rate 25 bps to 16.25 pct.
newsitem.headline: Czech CSOB lowers prime rate 25 bps to 16.25 pct.

text.p: Prague-based Ceskoslovenska Obchodni Banka a.s. said on Wednesday that it was lowering its prime lending rate 25 basis points to 16.25 percent.

In a statement the bank said that its base rates would be lowered 50 basis points, meaning credit with maturity up to one year will have a rate of 16.5 percent, with longer maturities at 16.00 percent.
Czech banks have been gradually lowering their rates in recent weeks reflecting the trends on the interbank market.
